result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 3-18-17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, credit for 65 days

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

Restitution set at zero.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Court advised the defendant he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript PLEA &  SENTENCING HEARING (36 pages) commencing MARCH 18, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Joseph J Brown in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Joseph J Brown in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Annette K.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 65 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 3/18/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 3/18/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Complete 20 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Joseph J Brown not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives the defendants appearance for todays proceedings. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 3/18/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Joseph J Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Joseph J Brown in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph J Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Joseph J Brown in custody.  Joy M Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph J Brown
Current: 2575 W McKinley Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 01-16-2014)
Prior: 1955 South 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
